hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition on Failed Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a 20-day Bollinger Band width compression (<15%) within a neutral regime, a failed breakout attempt (price rejects above upper band then closes below middle band within 3 days) predicts transition to bear regime with 70% probability within 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral markets represents indecision. Failed breakouts from compression often precede directional moves, with failed upside attempts particularly bearish as they trap long positions. Current MiCA regulatory uncertainty and CryptoQuant's bearish outlook create fundamental backdrop for failed rallies.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day BB width < 15% for 5 consecutive days
Price touches or exceeds upper BB then closes below 20-day SMA
ETH/BTC ratio shows weakness (<0.034) confirming broad crypto weakness

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% drop from entry price OR bear regime confirmed (regime confidence > 70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 5% rise above entry price OR successful breakout above upper BB with volume confirmation
exit_conditions.time_exit: 10 trading days without bear regime transition

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such signals result in immediate bullish continuation above compression range within 5 days, or bear regime transition occurs less than 55% of the time within the 10-day window.
